security_audit.summary: After evaluating all 84 static findings, this skill is SAFE. The vast majority of detections are false positives from documentation and reference materials containing example code snippets. The backtick patterns are from markdown code blocks, not executable Ruby commands. The MD5 references are educational examples showing weak algorithms to avoid. The Python scripts are legitimate development utilities that write local files for scaffolding purposes.

content.user_title: Build Production-Ready Backend Systems with Expert Guidance
content.value_statement: Backend development requires expertise in APIs, databases, security, and scalable architecture. This skill provides senior-level guidance for building robust server-side applications with industry best practices.
actual_capabilities: Design RESTful and GraphQL APIs with proper versioning and documentation strategies
Optimize database queries, indexes, and schema design for performance at scale
Implement authentication, authorization, and security best practices for backend systems
Generate API scaffolding, load testing scripts, and database migration utilities
Architect scalable backend systems with caching, rate limiting, and error handling patterns
Provide code reviews for backend implementations with focus on security and performance
limitations: Does not deploy applications to cloud infrastructure or manage production environments
Cannot execute database migrations or perform actual load testing without user confirmation
Focuses on general backend patterns rather than framework-specific advanced features
Does not provide real-time monitoring or debugging of live production systems

use_cases.title: API Architecture Review and Optimization
use_cases.description: Review existing API designs for scalability issues and receive recommendations for caching, rate limiting, and versioning strategies.

use_cases.title: Database Performance Troubleshooting
use_cases.description: Analyze slow queries, design optimal indexes, and implement query optimization strategies for relational and NoSQL databases.

use_cases.title: Security Audit and Best Practices Implementation
use_cases.description: Implement authentication flows, secure credential management, input validation, and protection against common backend vulnerabilities.

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Design
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a new REST API endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a REST API endpoint for user registration that includes proper validation, error handling, and security measures. Show me the request and response structure with HTTP status codes.

prompt_templates.title: Database Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: My user search query is slow when filtering by multiple fields. Analyze the current query structure and suggest index strategies and query optimizations for PostgreSQL.

prompt_templates.title: Security Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement JWT-based authentication for my Node.js API including token generation, refresh token handling, and middleware for protected routes. Include security best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a microservices architecture for an e-commerce platform with separate services for inventory, orders, and payments. Include communication patterns, database strategies per service, and fault tolerance mechanisms.

output_examples.input: Design a rate limiting strategy for my public API
output: Recommended strategy: Token bucket algorithm with Redis backend
Configuration: 100 requests per minute per API key, 1000 per hour
Implementation: Middleware checks Redis counter before processing request
Error handling: Return 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After header
Tiered limits: Different quotas for free, premium, and enterprise tiers

output_examples.input: Help me optimize this slow JOIN query across three tables
output: Analysis: Missing composite index on foreign key columns used in JOIN conditions
Recommendation: Create index on orders(user_id, created_at) for efficient filtering
Query rewrite: Use INNER JOIN instead of subqueries to leverage index optimization
Additional optimization: Add covering index to avoid table lookups for selected columns
Performance estimate: Query time should reduce from 2.3s to under 50ms with proper indexes
Monitoring advice: Use EXPLAIN ANALYZE to verify index usage after implementation

output_examples.input: Generate scaffolding for a new microservice with authentication
output: Project structure created with controllers, services, models, and middleware directories
Authentication module with JWT generation, validation, and refresh token logic
Database connection setup with connection pooling and error handling
Environment configuration template for database credentials and JWT secrets
Docker compose file for local development with database and Redis containers
API documentation template with OpenAPI specification and example endpoints

best_practices: Always validate and sanitize user input at API boundaries before processing or storing data in databases
Use connection pooling and prepared statements for database queries to improve performance and prevent SQL injection attacks
Implement proper error handling with consistent error response formats and avoid exposing sensitive system information in error messages
anti_patterns: Avoid storing sensitive credentials or API keys directly in code or version control systems instead of using environment variables or secret management
Do not perform complex business logic or heavy computations directly in database queries when application layer processing is more maintainable
Never skip authentication and authorization checks on internal API endpoints assuming network-level security is sufficient

faq.question: What backend frameworks and languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill provides language-agnostic patterns applicable to Node.js, Python, Java, Go, and other backend technologies with examples adaptable to your stack.

faq.question: Can this skill help with both SQL and NoSQL database optimization?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill covers optimization strategies for relational databases like PostgreSQL and MySQL as well as NoSQL solutions like MongoDB and Redis.

faq.question: Does this skill generate production-ready code or just guidance?
faq.answer: It provides both architectural guidance and code generation for scaffolding, utilities, and common patterns that require review before production use.

faq.question: How does this skill handle security best practices?
faq.answer: It incorporates OWASP guidelines, secure authentication patterns, input validation, and protection against common vulnerabilities like SQL injection and XSS.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for microservices architecture design?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill covers microservices patterns including service communication, database per service, API gateways, and distributed system considerations.

faq.question: What types of API design does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports REST, GraphQL, and RPC patterns with guidance on versioning, documentation, rate limiting, and pagination strategies.
